descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of lawmaking processes at any level of government.
Demonstrates a very limited understanding of lawmaking processes, with significant inaccuracies or omissions.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of lawmaking processes at one level of government (national, state, or local) but lacks understanding of the others.
Demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of lawmaking processes at two levels of government, with some minor inaccuracies or omissions.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of lawmaking processes at all three levels of government, with only minor errors.
Demonstrates a thorough and insightful understanding of lawmaking processes at all three levels of government, including nuances and complexities.
Makes no attempt to compare lawmaking processes across different levels of government.
Attempts to compare lawmaking processes but provides inaccurate or superficial comparisons.
Provides a limited comparison of lawmaking processes, identifying only a few similarities or differences.
Provides a satisfactory comparison of lawmaking processes, identifying several similarities and differences at different levels of government.
Provides a comprehensive comparison of lawmaking processes, identifying key similarities and differences, and explaining the reasons for them.
Provides an insightful and nuanced comparison of lawmaking processes, demonstrating a deep understanding of the factors that shape lawmaking at different levels of government.
Does not address the role of lobbying or the media in lawmaking.
Mentions lobbying or the media but provides inaccurate or irrelevant information.
Describes the role of lobbying or the media in lawmaking in a limited or superficial way.
Explains the role of lobbying and the media in lawmaking at one or two levels of government, with some limitations.
Explains the role of lobbying and the media in lawmaking at all three levels of government, providing relevant examples.
Analyzes the role of lobbying and the media in lawmaking, demonstrating a critical understanding of their influence and impact.
